interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: HOCUS POCUS
Review Date: 2019/12/02
Store: Bette Midler  (Actor),     Sarah Jessica Parker  (Actor),     Kenny Ortega  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['In Disney\'s HOCUS POCUS, Academy Award(R) nominee Bette Midler (Best Actress, 1991, FOR THE BOYS), stars with Sarah Jessica Parker (SEX AND THE CITY) and Kathy Najimy (THE WEDDING PLANNER) as three wild witches who return from seventeenth-century Salem for a night of zany fun and comic chaos. After they\'re conjured up by unsuspecting pranksters, the tricky trio sets out to cast a spell on the town and reclaim their youth. But first they must outwit three feisty kids determined to foil their scheme! Filled with bewitching laughs and magic, this hilarious film is perfect for the whole family!|Producer David Kirschner came up with the idea for the movie one night while he and his young daughter were sitting outside and his neighbor\'s black cat strayed by. Kirschner began to unspool a narrative of how the cat was once a boy who was changed into a feline 300 years ago by three witches.|Actress Kathy Najimy described her character Mary as "Eddie Haskell as a witch," referring to the character on the classic TV series "Leave It To Beaver." "She sucks up to Winifred [Bette Midler\'s character] every chance she gets. She wants to be part of the power club and Winifred\'s got the power."|To create the costumes, designer Mary Vogt read many historical books about Salem, Massachusetts. "I even read diaries of women who were hanged as witches," she says.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'ACTION, Comedy, LIVE', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Stephanie Faracy, Sean Murray, Sarah Jessica Parker, D.A. Pawley, Bette Midler, Thora Birch, Don Yesso, Neil Cuthbert, Amanda Shepherd, Steve Voboril, Doug Jones, Kathy Najimy, Kathleen Freeman, Kenny Ortega, Tobias Jelinek, Norbert Weisser, Larry Bagby, Karyn Malchus, Vinessa Shaw, Mick Garris, Ezra Sutton, Omri Katz, Charles RocketStephanie Faracy, Sean Murray, Sarah Jessica Parker, D.A. Pawley, Bette Midler, Thora Birch, Don Yesso, Neil Cuthbert, Amanda Shepherd, Steve Voboril, Doug Jones, Kathy Najimy, Kathleen Freeman, Kenny Ortega, Tobias Jelinek, Norbert Weisser, Larry Bagby, Karyn Malc…   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Item model number': 'D149900D', 'Director': 'Kenny Ortega', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 31, 2018', 'Actors': 'Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker, Kathy Najimy, Omri Katz, Thora Birch', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Mick Garris, Neil Cuthbert', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: It's a classic my autistic daughter wanted a hard copy of this to watch whenever she wanted so we purchased.
Review Title: Classic.
Rating: 5.0

It's clearly not, and from what I can tell (I only watched 20 minutes it's not that great of a movie. Not a Documentary {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky'], 'Producers': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky', 'IFC'], 'Starring': ['Delbert Ward', 'Roscoe Ward', 'Connie Chung']} I felt this was well done and true. No need to make a story this one tells itself in the footage alone and does a great job. I think it is easy to understand the peoples emotions in this movie and how they feel about the family. Well Done {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Richard Press'], 'Producers': ['Philip Gefter'], 'Starring': ['Bill Cunningham', 'Anna Wintour', 'Tom Wolfe'], 'Studio': ['Zeitgeist Films']} I love a good documentary about talented interesting people and this is one of them for sure. You really fall for Bill's simplicity and his talent. What a neat person. Love him~ Surviving Progress Margaret Atwood (Actor), Colin Beavan (Actor), Mathieu Roy (Director), Harold Crooks (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary ['Product Description', 'Technological advancement, economic development, population increase - are they signs of a thriving society? Or too much of a good thing? Based on the best-selling book a Short History of Progress, this provocative documentary explores the concept of progress in our modern world, guiding US through a sweeping but detailed survey of the major "progress traps" facing our civilization in the arenas of technology, economics, consumption, and the environment. Featuring powerful arguments from such visionaries as Jane Goodall, Margaret Atwood, Stephen Hawking, Craig Venter, Robert Wright, Michael Hudson, and Ronald Wright, this enlightening and visually spectacular film invites US to contemplate the progress traps that destroyed past civilizations and that lie treacherously embedded in our own. Leading critics of Wall Street, cognitive psychologists, and ecologists lay bare the consequences of progress-as-usual as the film travels around the world - from a burgeoning China to the disappearing rainforest\'s of Brazil to a chimp research lab in New Iberia, Louisiana - to construct a shocking overview of the way our global economic system is eating away at our planet\'s resources and shackling entire populations with poverty. Providing an honest look at the risks and pitfalls of running 21st Century "software" (our accumulated knowledge) on 50,000-year-old "hardware" (our primate brains), Surviving Progress offers a challenge: To prove making apes smarter was not an evolutionary dead end.', 'Review', "MIND-EXPANDING... SUBVERSIVE... BRISTLING WITH PROVOCATIVE INSIGHTS. Both brainy and light on its feet, and with wide variety of involving visuals, this mind-expanding ecological documentary bristles with provocative insights and probing questions about humanity and the state of the world. --Kenneth Turan, LA TimesA who's-who of great thinkers are riveting as they walk us through the question of whether we will or can survive progress. --Ernest Hardy, Seattle WeeklyCRITIC'S CHOICE. EXCELLENT! Succinct and entertaining. Weaves together a vast assortment of materials as well as information, to highly watchable results. Do the earth a favor: see this movie, and drag a skeptic you know along. --Dennis Harvey, San Francisco Bay Guardian"] {'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Gary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon JohnsonGary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon Jo… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25729809', 'Director': 'Mathieu Roy, Harold Crooks', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 25, 2012', 'Actors': 'Margaret Atwood, Colin Beavan, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Michael Hudson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'First Run Features', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} This one really gets you thinking and inspires change. Dull American Girl: Grace Stirs Up Success Olivia Rodrigo (Actor), Eloise Webb (Actor), Vince Marcello (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure ["Grace has a real talent for baking and a passion for making delicious dreams come true. When her mom announces a trip to visit relatives in Paris, Grace isn't so sure about leaving her friends and their cupcake business. That is, until she discovers she'll get to work with her uncle and cousin in a real French pastry shop! But nothing goes as planned and her attempts to help out end in disaster. With some help from her family and a pup named Bonbon, she turns her vacation around. But when Grace returns home, she discovers her grandparents' bakery is in trouble! With their dreams on the line, can Grace find the winning recipe for success?", 'Bonus Content:', 'Masterchef Junior', 'Masterchef Junior', 'Doggie Day Spa', 'Doggie Day Spa', 'Playing Dress Up', 'Playing Dress Up', ']]>'] {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '33679142', 'Director': 'Vince Marcello', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 23, 2015', 'Actors': 'Olivia Rodrigo, Eloise Webb, Caitlin Carmichael, Notlim Taylor, Joe Bastianich', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Debra Martin Chase, Jean A. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Preferred Genres:** The user enjoys documentaries and heartfelt romances while exploring a range of genres, including light-hearted comedies and family-friendly films. Their recent viewing habits show an appreciation for stories that blend complex characters with humor, showcasing an expanded taste in storytelling.

- **Expectations:** The user seeks authenticity and genuine representation in films, valuing emotional connection and entertainment. Their engagement with narratives that have zany fun yet maintain depth highlights their nuanced understanding of storytelling.

- **Engagement Duration:** The user's flexible viewing choices reflect a balance between critical insight and enjoyment. They appreciate emotionally resonant films but also delight in charming, escapist narratives suited for family viewing, which enrich their overall cinematic experience.

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user has demonstrated a capacity to fully enjoy films that evoke strong emotions, as evidenced by their recent high rating for a classic film. Their ratings indicate a nuanced differentiation between inherent entertainment value and authentic representation.

- **Content Appreciation:** The user favors emotional narratives while embracing light-hearted elements. Their evolving engagement with diverse storytelling continues to enhance their selective yet broadened approach to film and media, blending heartfelt stories with fun, family-oriented content. 

Overall, the user remains dedicated to authentic storytelling while enjoying varied narratives that inspire joy and emotional resonance.
